articles.headline: Hunting for Money, Democrats Rush to Rewrite Tax Code
articles.snippet: Lawmakers are racing to finalize legislation to pay for new spending initiatives. The process usually takes months, but they are trying to do it in days.
articles.abstract: Lawmakers are racing to finalize legislation to pay for new spending initiatives. The process usually takes months, but they are trying to do it in days.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As they hunt for revenue to pay for their sprawling spending bill and try to unite a fractured caucus, Democrats are attempting to rewrite the United States tax code in a matter of days, proposing the kind of sweeping changes to how America taxes businesses and individuals that would normally take months or years to enact.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: Michelle Wu Makes Her Play for Power in Boston
articles.snippet: A family crisis diverted Ms. Wu from the stable path her parents planned for her. Now she hopes to become mayor.
articles.abstract: A family crisis diverted Ms. Wu from the stable path her parents planned for her. Now she hopes to become mayor.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — Michelle Wu was weeks away from her first City Council election when she lost her voice.

articles.headline: Old Power Gear Is Slowing Use of Clean Energy and Electric Cars
articles.snippet: Some people and businesses seeking to use solar panels, batteries and electric vehicles find they can’t because utility equipment needs an upgrade.
articles.abstract: Some people and businesses seeking to use solar panels, batteries and electric vehicles find they can’t because utility equipment needs an upgrade.
articles.lead_paragraph: Seven months after workers finished installing solar panels atop the Garcia family home near Stanford University, the system is little more than a roof ornament. The problem: The local utility’s equipment is so overloaded that there is no place for the electricity produced by the panels to go.

articles.headline: China Hurries to Burn More Coal, Putting Climate Goals at Risk
articles.snippet: Faced with electricity shortages, the country is racing to expand mining despite risks to the environment, miner safety and the economy.
articles.abstract: Faced with electricity shortages, the country is racing to expand mining despite risks to the environment, miner safety and the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: LINFEN, China — Desperate to meet its electricity needs, China is opening up new coal production exceeding what all of Western Europe mines in a year, at a tremendous cost to the global effort to fight climate change.

articles.headline: U.S. Recovery Hurt by Virus Surge and Supply Chain Troubles
articles.snippet: New data shows how bottlenecks and the Delta variant slowed economic growth in the third quarter. Relief may be slow.
articles.abstract: New data shows how bottlenecks and the Delta variant slowed economic growth in the third quarter. Relief may be slow.
articles.lead_paragraph: Economic growth slowed sharply over the summer, the government reported Thursday, reflecting the resurgent pandemic’s impact in keeping consumers at home and the supply-chain bottlenecks that led to empty shelves and higher prices.

articles.headline: The 37-Year-Olds Are Afraid of the 23-Year-Olds Who Work for Them
articles.snippet: Twenty-somethings rolling their eyes at the habits of their elders is a longstanding trend, but many employers said there’s a new boldness in the way Gen Z dictates taste.
articles.abstract: Twenty-somethings rolling their eyes at the habits of their elders is a longstanding trend, but many employers said there’s a new boldness in the way Gen Z dictates taste.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a millennial with a habit of lurking on TikTok, Jessica Fain understood that skinny jeans and side parts were on the steady march toward extinction. But when Ms. Fain, who works as a product manager at a large tech company, heard that some of her favorite emojis might also be confronting retirement — namely that laughing-sobbing face — she decided to seek the counsel of her junior colleagues.
